Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: cali2510
Reviews.Content: Location is probably THE BEST one could find in Madrid for such an affordable price. Walking distance from everywhere: tourist attractions, nightlife, metro, supermarket... Makes visiting the city a lot easier. 24-hour service provided by very nice staff and wi-fi access makes it even better. Check-in is at noon but if the room is ready, you can have an early check-in, free of further charge, like us. Gladly surprised that there where three bathrooms in a single aisle for people that chose to share a bathroom. We were expecting having to wake up early or waiting in line to take a bath, but not what happened at all. Never had to wait a minute :). Now, to be honest, rooms without a balcony are very, very small and there's no elevator, so you'll climb a few stairs carrying your bags. Showers are really really small as well, and it's hard to take a bath without splashing the whole bathroom.That's just advice for picky people. Whatever somebody may dislike about this place is well compensated for the awesome location. We were very happy with our experience there and, as a matter of fact, since our flight to L.A. leaves from Madrid and we'll have to spend one more night there after a month traveling, we canceled a reservation in another hotel, so we can stay there again that last night!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: paxmaruda
Reviews.Content: It's a small hostal located in nice area full of good bars and restaurants. There is Mercado de San Miguel and a supermarket on the same street. All major attractions are within walking distance. Whole place was very clean and quiet. My room was small, equipped with cheap, but new furniture. Bed was really comfortable. There was a TV in the room, but without any English channels. The only problem was WIFi not working well there. I can't complain about shared bathrooms, they were clean all the time. Staff was friendly and spoke some English. I highly recommend this place. It was better than I expected for price not much higher than bed in hostel dormitory.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and small place to stay in Madrid center.”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandr550
Reviews.Content: It was one of the cheapest options in the city center when I was looking for an accommodation for a 2 nights stay in Madrid. Hostal location is rather good, close to Puerta del Sol, The Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor. An old Mercado with a lot of shops and small eateries is in front of the hostal. Hostal provides basic accommodation, we had a small twin room. Bathrooms were outside in a corridor. They didn`t serve breakfast. Towels were for hire and cost 1 euro. Much noise were heard from the street, especially at night. One should have in mind that they don`t have 24 hours reception. When we were leaving early in the morning we just dropped our room keys into a post box. As a whole we were satisfied as it was cheap, small place to stay with a good location to explore Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “If you keep expectations low, it's great (!)”
Reviews.Author: IvanCDG
Reviews.Content: This place is cheap and basically runs like a youth hostel, except that you have a private room to yourself. It is VERY clean. It is quiet, and yet the location is EXCELLENT. Beware: the staff don't speak English. The problem is the shared shower/bathrooms. Depending on who the other guests are, your shower experience might be compromised by the bad hygiene of the person before you. I would stay there again, just because of the great value for the neighborhood. If you have a sense of humor, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Renée R
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean and bathrooms were also clean. Disappointing that there weren't any lockers in the rooms for you to lock away valuables but the location of this hostel more than made up for that. Directly opposite the Mercado San Miguel and with lots of great places surrounding to go for good food and good wine. There is however the problem with the other noisy travellers that stay here and also the noise from the outside recycling bins being emptied. However, personally, I did not find it a bother. My two other companions did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, bad beds, staff didn't speak english with me,but with other travellers yes”
Reviews.Author: dqu2890
Reviews.Content: I've been there fore 3 nights. The location is perfect, right in the center, in front of Mercado de San Miguel. We arrived and the guy from the reception didn't understand english.. So i spoke a mix of italian, but I understood him. I paid the first night by credit card in advance, but he didn't get it that we payed and couldn't count 200-40... Than after we finally got it and went to the rooms. I forgot my towel at home and went back to the reception and i've seen, that the guy NOW was speaking English with other tourists, but with me he spoke only spanish! The rooms were ok, but the bed not! They were from IKEA and it was not the best. Bathrooms were ok, cleaned every day....

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Valevalencia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night with wife and friends in a shared room. We'd only booked a room for 4 but got to a room for 6 all to our selves. The place looks recently done up. Although on the cheap. And it's clean and all. It's a hostal not a hostel so do not expect a great social element. However the bathrooms are shared and can run low on hot water. There's plenty of bathrooms all in decent to good condition so not much of a queue. The people running the place are nice and friendly. The place itself is just opposite the market in the plaza which is not as noise as you might expect but dont expect to sleep through the noise when the bins get emptied in the morning. All in all we were all four very happy with our stay here. The central location is absolutely amazing for the price and although cheap it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't find a more central place to stay at such a great price!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaThreadgold
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hostel enough ... it is smack bang in the centre of Madrid! Despite being a large capital city, everything is within walking distance and the hostal itself is great. My boyfriend and I stayed in a private twin room for just 15 euros per person per night and the room was great - spacious with large windows looking out onto the sqaure, two comfortable beds and two fans, which certainly came in use! There is an indoor market and bars/restaurants on the square which of course creates noise but this stops around midnight. The hostel is between TWO supermarkets, which is very handy! The staff are also very friendly and helpful - we were put in the wrong room by mistake so when we arrived back at the hostel midnight, we were informed that reception staff had moved all our stuff into the other room and explained that there had been a mistake, which was fine. The bathrooms are also clean and the showers are good. The hostel won "best staff" award from hostelbookers.com earlier this year, and it really shows.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal La Casa de La Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza de San Miguel 5, 28005 Madrid, Spain
